title: The works of Professor Wilson of the University of Edinburgh,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: The three merry harvest-homes at Raeshaw, Ladyside, and Bracken Braes, were not over till the first week in December.

author: Wilson, John

title: The works of Professor Wilson of the University of Edinburgh,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: Ruth and Miles had taken farewell of the few families in whose houses they had familiarly sat, especially those at Raeshaw, Ladyside, and the Manse ; so there was nothing more to do in the view of their departure.

title: The works of Professor Wilson of the University of Edinburgh,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: Agnes then thought of Bracken Braes, and its solitary pastoral valley, where she knew almost every single bush, and every linn that murmured over its shelving rocks — the few houses, too, from Raeshaw down to the Manse.
